item.title: About foodstruk
item.dc:creator: foodstruk
item.content:encoded:
foodstruk.com is all about posting simple and quick cooking methods. Life's so busy that it gets difficult to cook whole meals, the idea at foodstruk is to share tasty, healthy and one pot meals so that we all can have healthy home cooked food daily.

We appreciate your likes, comments and suggestions, follow to see latest from us, thanks for visiting.

Happy cooking!

Cheers!!!

item.title: Andhra Chicken Pepper Fry (Andhra Kodi Vepudu)
item.dc:creator: foodstruk
item.content:encoded:
Andhra chicken pepper fry is an authentic delicacy that is made in almost every household of Andhra and as well in Telangana. Also popular as Andhra Kodi Vepudu. Easy and quick recipe, very few ingredients are required in the making. The curry leaves and pepper bring bold flavors into the chicken.

Ingredients: For 2 persons.

  • Chicken - 1 lb or 0.5 Kg
  • Onion - 1 chopped
  • Green Chilies - 3 to 4
  • Ginger - 1/2 inch
  • Garlic - 3 Cloves
  • Curry leaves - 2 stems
  • Oil - 3 teaspoons
  • Salt - Adequate
  • Turmeric - a pich
  • cumin seeds -1/2 tsp
  • Chicken masala - 1/2 teaspoon
  • Black Pepper -  Coarsely ground (1 tablespoon)

Procedure:

  • Grind the Ginger and Garlic and make the ginger garlic paste.
  • Add the salt and turmeric to the chicken. Heat some oil in a vessel and add the chicken to it. Cook it for around 5-7 minutes on medium flame.

  • Heat 2 teaspoons of oil in a pan, now add the cumin seeds. After they crackle, add the chopped onions. Once they look translucent add ginger-garlic paste and chicken masala.
  • Fry the onions till they turn brown a little, now add the chicken and check for salt. Add salt if required. Also let the water evaporate.
  • Then add the curry leaves, cook for 2 mins and then add coarsely ground pepper and leave it for 2 mins and turn the stove off.

  • Now the Andhra Chicken Fry is ready to be served... Can server as a starter or a side dish. I enjoy it with Dal & Rice, also with Kerala Parathas.

 Enjoy!!!!! We appreciate your likes, comments and suggestions.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Looks tasty and want to try it out...

item.title: Coconut Cooler
item.dc:creator: foodstruk
item.content:encoded:
I'm a fan of coconut milk, so creamy and rich. Very versatile, can be used in curries, entrees, desserts, drinks etc., A great substitute for people who are allergic to dairy stuff. Easily available in all the grocery stores.

Today I'll be presenting a recipe for a drink/cocktail called the Coconut Cooler. Perfect for summers, very easy and quick to make. Great choice for parties, pot lucks or just for the family gathering.

I'd once tried Coconut Cooler in P.F. Chang's and have loved it since. So tried to replicate it at home. Following is the recipe: Serves 2 persons

Ingredients:

  • Coconut milk: 20 ml
  • Coconut water: 30 ml
  • Cane syrup: 4 teaspoons (if you don't have cane syrup you can use 5-6 teaspoons of sugar syrup depending on your sweetness level).
  • Ice cubes
[caption id="attachment_24" align="alignnone" width="200"] Coconut Cooler Ingredients[/caption] Method:
  1. Take few ice cubes in a glass
  2. Add the coconut milk
  3. Add the coconut water
  4. Add the cane syrup
  5. Ready to serve/drink
[caption id="attachment_409" align="alignnone" width="300"] Coconut Cooler[/caption] 
You can try a lot of variations with it. I tried rose flavor by adding a little Roohafza to it (use rose water if you don't have it).

Also vanilla flavor by adding vanilla flavor (I added less than a drop... don't know the unit for it :D).

For the alcohol lovers;  you can add some vodka/gin to it.
Hope you enjoy it! Comments and suggestions are welcome.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Looks cool would love to try it as explained in the recipe With vodka! 😀
It looks very tasty and would love to try it This Sunday I will chill with coconut cooler

item.title: Chia Seed Drinks
item.dc:creator: foodstruk
item.content:encoded:
Chia seeds also called as Basil seeds, also known as Takmari, Sabjya etc., in India. You can find these seeds with these names in Indian stores in US.

These tiny seeds pack a powerful punch of nutrients. They are loaded with fiber, protein and omega-3 fatty acids. Due to the high fiber and protein content, it helps you to lose weight. They can be soaked in juice or blended in smoothies.

You can make a variety of drinks using Chia seeds, lets go ahead and talk about few a drinks using Chia seeds;
Chia-Honey Drink:
Ingredients:
  1. Chia Seeds - 1 teaspoon
  2. Honey - 1 table spoon
  3. Water - 3/4 of a glass
Procedure:
  1. Soak a teaspoon of Chia seeds overnight in half glass of drinking water.
    1. 2-3 hours should also suffice.
    2. Preferably refrigerated.
  2. Mix the Chia seeds, Water (preferably chilled) and Honey in a glass.
[caption id="attachment_92" align="alignnone" width="300"] Chia-Honey Drink[/caption]
Chia-Roohafza Drink
Ingredients:
  1. Chia Seeds - 1 teaspoon
  2. Roohafza - 1 table spoon
  3. Water - 3/4 of a glass
Procedure: Perform the same steps as of Chia-Honey drink, except use Roohafza instead of Honey.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Sounds interesting and new this is a definite try of the day.

item.title: The 'No-fail', Perfect, Simple Idli Recipe
item.dc:creator: foodstruk
item.content:encoded:
Idli is a cake (usually two to three inches in diameter and are made by steaming a batter consisting of fermented black lentils and parboiled rice) that is popular throughout India and neighboring countries like Sri Lanka.

Who doesn't love Idlis. Staple breakfast of South India. Well everyone knows how to make Idlis but not everyone always has soft, fluffy, melt in mouth Idlis. I have just perfected it only recently.

Here's my method:
    • Wash and soak 1/2 cup  urad dal (preferably whole) separately overnight.
    • Wash and soak 2 cups parboiled rice (some also call it ukhda chawal) with few (5-6) Methi (Fenugreek) seeds.
The Methi (Fenugreek) seeds are basically used for making Idlis fluffy & soft. 5-6 hours is good enough for soaking. We soak the Dal and Rice separately because we want to grind the Dal fine and the rice a bit coarse (just a bit, not much).
    • Then we grind the Dal fine, take it out and then grind the rice with Methi seeds (bit coarse) separately and leave it to ferment.
    • Sometimes it doesn't ferment or raise enough even when left to ferment, has happened with me sometimes. So I use my Mom's trick. THE TRICK IS TO MIX THE SALT (AS DESIRED) IN THE BATTER AND LEAVE IT. DON'T MIX IT TOO  HARD, DO IT GENTLY USING A SPATULA. By morning you'll get a great fluffy batter. If it's not raised enough you can add the baking soda as desired. Now they're ready to be steamed.
  • Add some water in the Idli cooker (minimum level, depends on the size of your cooker) for the steam. Grease the plates with oil and pour the batter in each accordingly.
If you have a small cooker (16 pieces, the one I use), it usually take less then 10 mins. You can test it by poking the knife in the Idli, if it comes out clean means they're done and if not you can wait for a minute or two. For the big one (24 pieces) it can take like 15 mins.
  • When they're ready to be taken out, dip the spoon in cold water and use it to take them out, the idlis come out easily without sticking to the plates(yes sometimes they do stick even after greasing the plates well).
Ready to serve with either Sambar or Chutney. [caption id="attachment_181" align="alignnone" width="300"] Idli[/caption] Enjoy!!!!! Comments and suggestions are welcome.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hey its idli my one of my favourite dishes... looks tasty and yummy...

item.title: Restaurant Style - Hyderabadi (DUM) Mutton Biryani
item.dc:creator: foodstrukeu
item.content:encoded:
The Hyderabad Mutton Biryani is an authentic, Nawabi cuisine straight from the kitchen's of the Nizams of the Hyderabad.

It is a spicy, fragrant and colorful variant of Biryani made in Hyderabad, India. The mutton (Gosht) is slowly cooked with mild spices, layered with rice and cooked on DUM until done.

Lets start with the marination ingredients and process.

Marination ingredients:

  • Mutton  2 lbs or 1 kg
  • Fried onions - 50 gm
  • Oil - 2 tablespoons
  • Bay leaves - 1
  • Clove - 4-5
  • Green Cardamom - 2-3
  • Black Cardamom - 1
  • Cinnamon stick 1/2 inch
  • Mint leaves -  a few
  • Coriander leaves - double the quantity of mint leaves
  • Salt - as desired
  • Lemon Juice - 1 tablespoon
  • Ginger garlic paste - 1-1/2 teaspoon
  • Green Chili Paste - 1/2 teaspoon
  • Chili powder - 1-1/2 tablespoon (according to your spice level)
  • Curd: 1 cup (preferably hung curd)
  • Optional: Meat tenderizer - 1 teaspoon (You can find it in any Indian grocery store)
Marinade Procedure:
  • Coarsely grind all dry spices mentioned above.
  • Take mutton in a bowl ( optionally; you can add meat tenderizer and rub it on the meet and leave it for 30 mins), then add adequate salt, lemon juice, Chili powder, ginger-garlic paste, add the freshly grounded Masala, add oil and add fried onions (50 gm). Mix everything well.
  • Now add the hung curd and mix it well. Taste the marinade and add if anything is less. Put a lid or a cling film to cover the bowl and let it marinade overnight in the fridge (if you don't have time 3-4 hours should also do, in this case I recommend using the meat tenderizer).
[caption id="attachment_147" align="alignnone" width="300"] Meat[/caption] [caption id="attachment_148" align="alignnone" width="300"] Marinade[/caption] Cooking Ingredients:
  • Oil - 2 tablespoon
  • Ghee - 2 tablespoons
  • Basmati rice - 750 gms
  • Shah zeera - 1 teaspoon
  • Saffron about 1 teaspoon soaked in a 1/4 cup of warm milk.
  • Cashews - 10
  • Green Cardamom - 4 - 5
  • Bay leaves - 2
  • Fried onions - 50 gm
  • Salt - as desired
  • Finely chopped mint leaves -  a few
  • Finely chopped coriander leaves - double the quantity of mint leaves
Cooking Procedure:
  • Soak Basmati for at least 30 mins.
  • Boil water in a heavy bottomed vessel, after it comes to a full boil add the salt (as desired), cloves, bay leaves , shah zeera, cardamom pods and oil 2 tablespoon.
[caption id="attachment_150" align="alignnone" width="294"] Rice cooking vessel[/caption] 
Make sure the salt is a bit more as we do not add it later.
  • Cook the rice on high flame for around 6-8 minutes or till its 50% cooked.
  • Meanwhile take another heavy bottomed dry Vessel (do not turn on the flame) and add a tablespoon oil and than add the marinade and spread it evenly.
[caption id="attachment_149" align="alignnone" width="300"] Biryani cooking vessel[/caption]
  • Carefully drain half the rice from the vessel when its 50% cooked and add it to the main Biryani vessel.
  • Apply 1 tablespoon of ghee, fried onions, cashews, half mint leaves and coriander leaves.
[caption id="attachment_151" align="alignnone" width="300"] The inner layer[/caption]
  • Drain the rest of the half when it is 60% cooked and add it on top of the Biryani cooking vessel.
  • Add the saffron milk on the top to give the Biryani rice a good color.
  • Apply remaining ghee, fried onions, cashews, mint and coriander leaves.
[caption id="attachment_152" align="alignnone" width="300"] Saffron layer[/caption] [caption id="attachment_153" align="alignnone" width="300"] Final Layer[/caption] 
While you are adding 50% cooked rice on top of the marinade, make sure you add it in small portions and add it evenly.
  • Close the lid and cook it on a medium flame for about 10 mins and then very low flame for 30/40 mins.
You can add a pan beneath the vessel after 10 mins of cooking on a medium flame, to avoid over cooking / burning the bottom as it needs very low flame.

Make sure the lid is tightly closed or add the wheat flour dough to seal the lid completely. This adds a flavor to the Biryani.
  • After 30/40 mins of low flame cooking, keep the lid closed and  let it rest for another 30 mins. Slowly open the lid and you'll see perfectly cooked the Biryani and ready to serve.
[caption id="attachment_154" align="alignnone" width="300"] Mutton Biryani[/caption] Hope you enjoy it! Likes, comments and suggestions are welcome!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: […] continuation with our Mutton Biryani here you go for the seafood lovers we present mouth watering Prawn Biryani for you. Good thing […]

item.title: Gongura Mutton Fry
item.dc:creator: foodstrukeu
item.content:encoded:
This is an Authentic Andhra Recipe. Very common delicacy in the rural areas of Andhra. Gongura (Roselle) is packed full of Iron, folic acid and other oxidants. An authentic Andhra non-vegetarian meal. The mutton is cooked these Roselle leaves that give a distinctive tangy taste.

Marinade Mix:
  • Mutton - 1 Kg or 2 Lbs
  • Salt - As desired
  • Lemon Juice - 1 teaspoon
  • Ginger Garlic paste - 1/2 teaspoon
  • Chili Powder  -  2 teaspoons
  • Oil - 1 table spoons

Marination Procedure: Add salt, Lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste and chili powder to it and mix it well. Marinate this for 1 hour.

Cooking Ingredients:
  • Onions - 2 chopped
  • Green chilies -3 (depends on your spice level)
  • Garlic - 2-3 chopped
  • Ginger - 1/2 inch chopped
  • Mint leaves - a few
  • Coriander - 1/2 cup chopped
  • Gongura leaves - 1 bunch
  • Whole garam masala:
    • Cinnamon stick - 1/2 inch
    • Cloves - 2-3
    • Cardamom - 2-3
    • Shah zeera - 1 tsp
    • Bay leaf - 1
  • Poppy seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Cashew nuts - 3-4
  • Cumin powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Coriander powder - 1 tsp
  • Curry leaves - 3-4 (optional)
  • Kasuri methi - a pinch (optional)
[caption id="attachment_166" align="alignnone" width="300"] Whole spices[/caption] [caption id="attachment_165" align="alignnone" width="300"] Gongura[/caption] Cooking Procedure:
  • Cook the marinaded meat in 1 tsp oil and keep it separately.
  • Now in a pan on medium flame, add 1 tbsp of oil and then add shah zeera and let crackle and add whole garam masala. After that add chopped onions, ginger garlic, chopped chilies.
  • Add adequate salt and fry till the onions get translucent.
  • Now add the cooked mutton into the pan.
  • Add the cumin and Coriander , poppy seeds and cashew powders.
  • After 5-10 mins, add the chopped Gongura leaves (also Kasuri methi ) and fry it for 10-15 mins.
  • Now check for the salt, spices and then garnish with coriander and mint leaves.
If you find the Gongura is too sour add a pinch of sugar to it.
This would go along with Chapati's/Naan's and rice. [caption id="attachment_157" align="alignnone" width="300"] Gongura Mutton Fry[/caption]

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Its awesome in taste can go with anything.

item.title: Pesarattu / Pesara dosa
item.dc:creator: foodstruk
item.content:encoded:
Pesarattu also known as 'Pesara dosa', it is a crepe-like bread similar to Dosa, made in Southern India especially in Andhra. It requires very little of rice compared to Dosa, making it healthy as the Green Grams (Moong dal) are low in fat and high in vitamin B, calcium, potassium, protein and fiber.

Lets start with batter preparation and its ingredients. Ingredients:
  • Whole Green Gram (Moong dal) - 2 Cups
  • Rice -  1/2 Cup
  • Fenugreek (Methi seeds) - 5 seeds
  • Green Chilies  - 2
  • Ginger - 1/4 Inch.
  • Salt - Adequate.
Procedure:

Soak whole green gram, rice and methi seeds for at least 4 to 5 hours and grind it to fine. While grinding also add adequate salt, green chilies and ginger and grind.

Unlike dosa, this batter need not be fermented, so we start soaking process in the night (or 4-5 hours before making) and grind it freshly in the morning and make Pesarattu.

Pesarattu goes well with the Ginger Chutney (Allam Pachhadi), Tamarind chutney, Coconut chutney. Pesarattu is also served with Upma and called as Pesarattu-Upma or MLA Pesarattu. Onion Pesarattu is another option like onion dosa and a delicious treat for onion lovers.

If you like it to be crunchy increase the quantity of rice a bit while soaking. Or just add some cooked rice / poha.

Here, we've made coconut mint chutney to go with the Pesarattu...

[caption id="attachment_210" align="alignnone" width="300"] Pesarattu[/caption]

Enjoy!!!!! We appreciate your likes, comments and suggestions.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Its looks tasty... nicely described thnx... for detail description....

item.title: Rasmalai / Ras malai / Rasha malai
item.dc:creator: foodstruk
item.content:encoded:
A savory cheese dumplings soaked in sweetened milk. It's one of my favorite Indian desserts. It looks daunting but actually is very easy to make. Also very few ingredients are required for it. I've tried to explain the steps in detail.

Ingredients for Chhena:

  • Milk-1 litre
  • Curd-1 cup
  • Some ice cubes or cold water

Procedure for chhena:

  • Boil 1 litre of milk in a heavy bottomed pan. Keep stirring the milk as Sometimes it tends to stick to the base.
  • Now just before it begins to boil add the curd and turn off the gas. Keep it aside for 4-5 minutes.
  • Once the milk's curdled add the ice cubes (or cold water) to it.
  • Now strain it into a white muslin cloth and wash under running water. Squeeze out the water completely and hang it for 2-3 hours. After 3 hours, transfer the chhena in a plate or a bowl and mash and knead to  smoothen it out .Also if you want you can mix a teaspoon of cornflour to it(optional).
  • Divide the chhena in small portions to make balls and then flatten it using your palms. Don't make them too big in size as they inflate after boiling in the sugar syrup.
To prepare the sugar syrup:
  • Water - 5 cups
  • Sugar - 1 cup
  • Cardamom - 3 to 4 Crushed
Procedure:
  • Heat a wide vessel on high flame, add the 5 cups of water and 1 cup of sugar and few cardamoms.
  • Wait till the water is bubbling hot..Then add the chhena  balls and close the lid. The flame should be on high throughout.
  • After 10 minutes turn off the gas and leave it for 10 mins or till it comes to room temperature.
  • The balls double in size on boiling and need space so don't overcrowd. If need be do it in two batches.

Sweetened Milk:

  • Milk - full fat 1 litre
  • Few strands of saffron
  • Chopped nuts
  • Sugar -4 tablespoons (or as sweet desired)
  • Cardamom - 4-5 crushed

Procedure:

  • In a heavy bottomed pan boil the milk. Once it comes to boil lower the flame and keep stirring for eight to ten till it thickens slightly or till you get your desired consistency on medium flame.
  • Add sugar to the milk
  • After that, add the cardamom powder an turn off the gas and let it come to room temperature.
  • Now  remove chhena from the syrup, gently press to remove the extra syrup and dip it into the milk.
  • For garnishing add the chopped nuts, saffron strands.
  • Chill it for sometime before serving.

Enjoy!!!! We appreciate your likes, comments and suggestions.

item.title: Bombay pav bhaji
item.dc:creator: foodstruk
item.content:encoded:
Ingredients:
Potatoes-1kg
Tomatoes-4 medium sized (puréed)
Capsicum-half (finely chopped)
Onions-2 medium sized
Green peas-1/2cup
Pav bhaji masala
Red chili powder-2tsp(as per your reqmt)
Cumin seeds-1/2 tsp
Turmeric-1/4tsp
Garam masala -1 tsp
Ginger garlic paste-1 tsp
Amul butter or any butter of your choice
1 lemon
Pav
Procedure:
Put the potatoes in a pressure cooker with some salt and turmeric for 1 whistle on medium flame.
Also pressure cook the peas separately till one whistle.
Now, mash the potatoes and peas together
Purée the tomatoes and keep aside.
Chop the onions and capsicum
Now heat some oil and 1 tbsp butter in a pan and add the cumin seeds, after they crackle add the onions
Add some salt so that the onions sweat and leave water early.
Add the ginger garlic paste
At this stage, when they get translucent add the capsicum.
After 5 mins, check the capsicum if it's cooked
Now add some salt, chili powder and garam masala. 
After 2-3 mins, add the purée
Now let the tomato purée cook on sim for sometime.
After 5-6 mins, you'll see the oil separating.
Now add the mashed mixture.
At this stage, you add water for consistency .let the water boil
Add the pav bhaji masala and close the lid let it cook on sim for 3-4mins.
Add some butter.
Garnish with some coriander.

item.title: Haleem (Goulash)
item.dc:creator: foodstrukeu
item.content:encoded:
Haleem is goulash composed of meat, lentils and wheat made into a thick paste. This Arabic dish was introduced during Nizams rule to Hyderabad.

It has been compared to that of Hyderabadi Biryani. It is consumed in Islamic month of Ramadan during Iftar as it is high in calories and provides instant energy.

Let's see how to prepare the famous dish.

Lets start with the  ingredients: 1) Mutton - 1 kg 2) Cashew & Badam (Almonds) optional - 100g combined 3) Ghee - 200g 4) Ginger Garlic Paste - 2 Tablespoon 5) Green chilies - 4 6) Coriander - 1/2 cup 7) Mint Leaves - 1/4 cup 8) Turmeric - pinch 9) Salt to taste 10) Yellow coarse semolina - 250g 11) Shahi Jeera - 1 teaspoon 12) Fried Onions - 100g 13) Water - adequate Spices : 1) Cloves-6 2) Cardamon-6 3) Cinnamon Sticks-2 4) Kabob chinni, also known as tailed pepper or Cubeb - half teaspoon (if unavailable use black pepper) 5) Black pepper - one table spoon 6) Bay leaf - 1

Lentils: 1) Green Gram Dal/Moong Dal - 75g 2) Black Gram whole/Urad Dal - 75g 3) Bengal Gram split/Chenna Dal - 75g 4) Beaten Rice flakes - 75g 5) Pigeon Peas Split/Toor Dal - 75g

Procedure: 1) Neatly wash Mutton pieces in a bowl.

2) Add Turmeric, salt to Mutton and cook them in pressure cooker for 8 whistles. If you find pieces are not cooked well, then keep them for 2 more whistles or until cooked.

3) Simultaneously, dry roast lentils all together in a pan and coarsely grind them after cooling. 4) Take half portion of all spices and grind them coarsely. I used Mortar & Pestle.

5) Take a thick bottomed vessel and heat 100g ghee on medium flame. 6) Once ghee is hot, add shahi jeera and remaining portion of spices. 7) Saute them for 1 minute and add fried onions. Optionally you can use fresh onion and saute it till onions turn brown in color. I used fried onions so that spices are not over roasted.

8) Add ginger garlic paste, sliced green chilies and saute them until raw flavor of ginger garlic paste is gone. 9) Add cooked mutton and stir it for 5 minutes. Add grounded lentils, semolina and mix them thoroughly and add coarsely grounded spices. You can optionally use grounded wheat grains, but I have used coarse semolina to simplify the process, as wheat grains takes lot of time to cook. 10) Also add chopped cilantro and mint leaves. Optionally add Cashew and Almonds. Keep stirring it frequently so that mix does not stick to the base. 11) Add little water to the mix and mash the mutton with help of masher till meat and bones are separated. You can remove un-crushed bones, but I left them to boil further for taste. 12) At this point, add adequate water and boil so that lentils and mutton are cooked further. Add some more water to loosen the consistency as desired. 13) Check the salt and spice level, add salt and grounded pepper if required. 14) Continuously mash the content for 20-30 minutes for consistency and also that it does not get stick to the bottom.

15) Add remaining ghee and continuously stir it for 15 minutes till you find Haleem is cooked and thick in consistency as shown. Once it is cooked you see the oil separates out.

Garnish it with some fried onions, cilantro and a wedge of lemon while serving.

Serve hot and enjoy!!! We appreciate your likes, comments and suggestions.
item.category: How to make Haleem at home

item.title: Sheer Khurma / Vermicelli Pudding
item.dc:creator: foodstrukeu
item.content:encoded:
Eid Mubbarak!!

It is vermicelli pudding prepared during the eve of Eid. It is a traditional Muslim festive dessert for celebrations. It is a very simple delicacy. Lets see the preparation steps.

Ingredients:

1) Dry Fruits: 1.1) Dates - 6 (sliced) 1.2) Cashew - 20 pieces (split) 1.3) Bhadam - 10 whole (sliced) 1.4) Chrionji/Charoli nuts (optional: It depends on individuals to add other dry fruits like pistachios)

2) Cardamon - 6 3) Sugar - 50 grams ( according to sweetness) 4) Milk - 1/2 liter 5) Roasted Vermicelli (Semiya) - 100 grams 6) Ghee - 50 grams 7) Saffron - little

Procedure:

1)  Take a pan,add ghee to heat and dry roast half the quantity of dry fruits (Dates, Cashew, Almonds (Badam)). Saute them for 3 minutes till they turn slight brown.

2) Rest half of the quantity, blend them into a paste.

3) In parallel, boil half liter milk in a vessel.

4) In case of normal Vermicelli, roast it after taking out dry fruits from pan. 5) Saute the blended dry fruit mix in pan for 1 minute in ghee on low flame.

6) Add milk to the above roasted dry fruit mix and Stir it for 5 minutes till the mix dissolves in milk.

8) Add sugar and let sugar dissolve. Stir the milk for 2 minutes 9) Add vermicelli and let it submerge in milk. Do not stir frequently, as it might cause vermicelli to break. 10) Simmer the stove and leave it for 5 minutes.

11) Garnish it with above roasted dry fruits and pinch of saffron and Serve it.

Enjoy !!! We appreciate your likes, comments and suggestions.

item.title: Ragi Sangati Mutton Pulusu (Finger Millet Cake w/ Mutton curry)
item.dc:creator: foodstruk
item.content:encoded:
Ragi Sangati (Ragi Mudda) is an authentic South Indian recipe especially in the areas of Rayalseema region, Karnataka and some parts of Tamilnadu and Odisha. Ragi (Finger Millet) has a great nutritional value (fibre, Calcium, and Iron).

Ragi Sangati goes well with many curries like mutton, chicken, gongura etc., for this blog will be considering mutton pulusu along with Ragi Sangati.

Lets start cooking with the Mutton Pulusu (Mutton curry) so that we can cook the Ragi Sangati later as it has be served hot.

Mutton Pulusu Ingredients:

  • Mutton - 1 lb (Lamb)
  • Onions - 3 chopped (preferably thin sliced)
  • Green chilies - 3 slit (depends on your spice level)
  • Ginger-garlic paste - 1 teaspoon
  • Coriander - 1/2 cup chopped (for garnishing)
  • Garam Masala  - 1 teaspoons
  • Cumin Powder - 1/2 teaspoons
  • Coriander powder - 1/2 teaspoons
  • Whole Garam Masala:
    • Cinnamon stick - 1/2 Inch
    • Cloves - 2-3
    • Start anise (Star Sompu) - 1
    • Shah Zeera - 1 tsp
  • Tomato - 2 roughly chopped
  • Coconut - 2 teaspoons desiccated (you can use fresh coconut if you do not have dry coconut)
  • Turmeric - 1/2 teaspoon
  • Oil - 2 tablespoon
  • Salt - Adequately

Procedure:

  • Wash the meat well and drain the water. Add salt (1-1/2 teaspoons), Turmeric and a tablespoon of oil to the meet.
  • Pressure cook the meat for three whistles on a medium flame. (Optionally you can add a little water, however it is not mandatory)
  • Simultaneously, take a heavy bottomed pan and on a medium flame heat a tablespoon of oil and when the oil is hot add the whole Garam Masala to it along with Shah Zeera.
  • After the zeera crackles, sautee the onions with some salt till they turn brown. Salt helps in turning brown faster.
  • Once the onions turn brown add ginger-garlic paste to it. Here reduce the flame to low.
  • Now add desiccated coconut to it, keep sauteing. after 2/3 minutes add garam masala powder, cumin and coriander powder.
  • After 2/3 minutes add 1 cup of water and cook it for 5 mins.
  • Now on medium flame, add chopped tomatoes and cook till 8-10 minutes or till the oil separates.
  • Now add the meat and cook it for another 10 mins. Check for salt and add if less.
  • Now add chopped coriander leaves.

Ragi Sangati Ingredients:

  • Ragi flour - 1 cup
  • Rice 1 cup
  • Salt - As desired
  • Water - 6 cups

Procedure:

  • Soak rice for at least 30 mins, then start cooking the rice in 4 cups of water.
  • Cook it until it gets soft ( little overcooked)
  • Meanwhile take 2 cups of water in a bowl, add the Ragi flour to it and keep stirring to avoid lumps.
  • Add this ragi water mix to the rice on low flame. Add adequate salt to it and keep stirring to avoid lumps. Now cover it with a lid and let it cook for 2-3 minutes on low flame.
  • Once the whole mixture is cooked turn off the gas and let it rest for 5 mins.
  • Take a bowl of cool water and dip your hand, take some portion of ragi rice in your palm to make balls.
  • Alternately you could grease a bowl with some oil or ghee, and put the ragi sangati in it. Now just invert it on the plate,  your ragi sangati ball is ready :)

Now both Ragi Sangati and Mutton Pulusu are ready. Please note that the Ragi Sangati has to be served hot.

Enjoy!!! We appreciate your likes, comments and suggestions.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Nice combination... Sangati is my childhood favorite... Just love it!!!

item.title: How to make Ghee (Clarified Butter) at home.
item.dc:creator: foodstruk
item.content:encoded:
Ghee is an integral part of almost every household in India. It has a wide range of use in Indian cooking like sautéing, tempering etc. In Ayurveda, it's shown to have a lot of medicinal properties too. 'Ghee' also called as Clarified Butter is made from unsalted butter/sweet cream. Ghee has a high smoking point compared to butter and therefore doesn't burn fast. It has a great flavor and can be used to make a variety of dishes and desserts.

Ingredients:

Unsalted butter sticks - 2 lbs

Method:

  • Take all the butter sticks and place it in a heavy bottomed vessel on medium heat.

  • Now let it melt completely and come to a boil.

  • Once it starts boiling you can see some froth/foam at the top.

  • Now turn the heat to low and cook for 10-15 mins (this time may vary depending on the stove).

  • Always keep stirring to make sure the milk solids don't  burn at the base.
  • At this stage you'll see some foam / froth form at the top, when you stir or move it you will find a change in color. It looks more golden-brown.

  • Turn off the gas. There'll be froth at top, to remove it just sprinkle few drops of water, it will bubble and after 2-3 minutes you'll see the froth gone.

  • After it cools down strain it into a jar or a container.
  • You can store at room temperature or in the fridge and ready to be used!

Tip:

1.You can add washed and dried curry leaves while making the ghee. It gives a more nutty  flavor and aroma.

2.if you're not particularly fond of the ghee smell you can add beetel leaves. They give a pleasant aroma and also increase the shelf life.
item.category: how to make indian clarified butter

item.title: Prawns Biryani
item.dc:creator: foodstrukeu
item.content:encoded:
In continuation with our Mutton Biryani here you go for the seafood lovers we present mouth watering Prawn Biryani for you. Good thing about it is, it is so much easier to cook than other Mutton/Chicken Biryani. These Prawns are slowly cooked with spices, layered with rice and cooked on DUM until done.

Lets get started with the Ingredients

  1. Prawn-500 gm
  2. Whole garam masala
  3. Shahjeera
  4. Ajwain (Optional)
  5. Fried Onions -1 cup
  6. Ginger Garlic-1 Table Spoon
  7. Green Chilly-3 chopped
  8. Coriander leaves -1 Cup chopped
  9. Mint leaves -1/2 Cup chopped
  10. Red chilly powder-1 Table Spoon
  11. Curd-One Cup
  12.  Oil-2 Table Spoons
  13. Turmeric-Pinch
  14. Ghee-1 Table Spoon
  15. Saffron-A Pinch
  16. Lemon -1
  17. Basmati Rice - 600 gms - Soak rice for at-least 30 mins.

Marinade Procedure:

  • Add little salt,few drops of lemon and little turmeric, apply evenly to prawns and wash them thoroughly. !! Careful do not squeeze prawns.

  • In a bowl, add some salt,half a teaspoon of  lemon,one teaspoon red chilly powder,half table spoon Ginger Garlic paste, and half of grounded whole garam masala, apply the mix evenly to prawns. Let it marinate for 30 min.

Main Procedure:

  • Take a thick bottomed vessel, add oil once it gets hot, add some shahjeera and little Ajwain.
  • Add few pieces of marinated prawns to pan and fry them for two min on both sides on medium flame. Remove and keep them in a bowl aside.
  • Fry remaining prawns in the same way and keep them aside.
  • Use the same vessel, add chopped green chilies, above fried prawns, remaining ginger garlic paste and grounded garam masala, fried onions, chopped coriander and mint leaves. Saute them for 1 min.
  • Add half cup of beaten curd, stir till the curd is properly mixed. Ensure that prawns are not broken.

  • Check salt and spices. Add if you feel it requires more. Keep aside the vessel.
  • Boil water in a big vessel, after it comes to a full boil add the salt (as desired), cloves, bay leaves , shahjeera, cardamom pods and oil 2 tablespoon.
  • Cook the rice on high flame till its 60% cooked.
  • Carefully drain half the rice from the vessel when its 60% cooked and add it to the above prawn vessel.
  • Apply 1 tablespoon of ghee, fried onions, cashews, half mint leaves and coriander leaves.
  • Drain the rest of the half when it is 80% cooked and add it on top of the Prawn cooking vessel.
  • Add the saffron milk on the top, to give the rice a good color and flavor.
  • Apply remaining ghee, fried onions, cashews, mint and coriander leaves, few drops of kewra water.

  • Close the lid and cook it on a medium flame for about 5 mins and then very low flame for 15/20 mins.
You can add a pan beneath the vessel after 5 mins of cooking on a medium flame, to avoid over cooking / burning the bottom as it needs very low flame.

Make sure the lid is tightly closed or add the wheat flour dough to seal the lid completely. This adds a flavor to the Biryani.
  • After 15/20 mins of low flame cooking, keep the lid closed and let it rest for another 30 mins. Slowly open the lid and you'll see perfectly cooked the Biryani and ready to serve.

Enjoy!!! We appreciate your likes, comments and suggestions.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Prawns biriyani looking nice & Recipe is good

item.title: Schezwan Mysore Masala Dosa
item.dc:creator: foodstruk
item.content:encoded:
We all love Dosas so much that's why we keep trying many variations with it. Today I like you to try Schezwan Mysore Masala Dosa. It tastes heavenly and healthy too as it is stuffed with lot of vegetables. You may have already tried it in restaurants or somewhere out. It may appear to be a long & time taking process to prepare, however if you get acquainted with the procedure its gets easy.

Before we get to the making of Schezwan Mysore Masala Dosa, we will see how to prepare the Dosa Batter for this.

Ingredients:

  • Urad dal - 1/2 cup
  • Rice - 2 cups
  • Methi / Fenugreek - 5 seeds
  • Cooked rice or soaked poha - 1 cup or as desired for crispiness.

Procedure:

  1. Wash the urad dal and rice gently and soak it for at least 6 hours . Add a few fenugreek seeds to it.
  2.  Add the rice and urad dal along with the cooked rice/soaked poha in the grinder jar. Add water as required but not much.
  3. The batter shouldn't be too runny or coarse.
  4. Let it ferment overnight.
  5. Now just before use, take out the quantity you want to use and add few pinches of cooking soda and salt as required.

Now see Masala Preparation:

Ingredients:

  • Potato - 2 nos boiled with salt and turmeric.
  • Rai & Jeera (Mustard & Cumin) - 1/2 teaspoon
  • Turmeric - 1/4 teaspoon.
  • Salt - Adequate
  • Coriander - few leaves chopped
  • Chilies - 2 chopped

Procedure:

  1. Cook the potatoes in a cooker with added salt and turmeric. Make sure its cooked well.
  2. Once cooked season it with Mustard & Cumin seeds. Add chilies, coriander leaves and adequate salt.
  3. Now the Masala is ready.

Finally lets get to the ingredients of schezwan mysore masala dosa:

  • Dosa Batter - Adequate for 4 dosa
  • Cabbage -  1 cup (cut into thin slices)
  • Beetroot / Carrot - 1 cup chopped in a processor
  • Onions -  2 chopped in a processor
  • Masala - Adequate for 4 dosas
  • Tomatoes - 2 chopped.
  • Salt - Adequate
  • Schezwan - 1 teaspoon per dosa.
  • Butter / Ghee - 1 teaspoon
Note: All these veggies and the Masala can be prepared a day before and refrigerated.

Procedure:

  • Take a pan (Preferably iron one) pour the dosa batter just like normal dosa on a medium flame.
  • Apply oil, I used ghee here...
  • Once you see the Dosa batter is starting to cook, reduce the flame to low.
  • Now in the middle of the Dosa start adding grated cabbage, carrot, beet, tomatoes and masala.
  • Add salt adequately. Apply little more 1/2 tspn oil or ghee or even butter on top of it and let it cook for a min
  • Now add Schezwan chutney to it and using masher start mashing the content.
  • Cook this for another minute or until the Dosa starts turning brown.
  • Now fold it and cut as shown if you like and serve hot.

Enjoy!!! We appreciate your likes, comments and suggestions.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Awesome thing... always love to eat such delicacies anytime...

item.title: Broccoli Spring Onion Stir Fry
item.dc:creator: foodstrukeu
item.content:encoded:
For all you weight watchers, this is a perfect dish-healthy and tasty. Very easy with few ingredients in less time. Ingredients:
  • Broccoli - 1 Bowl (cut in small florets)
  • Garlic - 3 Cloves finely chopped
  • Ginger - 1/2 Inch chopped
  • Chilies - 2 splitted
  • Thyme - 1/4 teaspoon
  • Olive oil - 1 tablespoon
  • Lime - As required
  • Peppercorn - Few coarsely crushed
  • Spring Onions -  few stems (cut and separate white base and green leaves)
  • Salt - As required
Method:
  • Heat the wok on medium flame. Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil now.
  • Once the oil gets heated add the chopped ginger & garlic to it.
  • Now add the broccoli florets , little salt, chilies and stir fry. After 2 minutes add the white spring onion base and continue stir fry.
  • Now add little coarsely crushed pepper and keep frying. Cover with lid and let it steam for 2-3 mins.
  • Add little thyme, and stir the fry.
  • After 3 mins, check salt and add it if required.
  • Add green part of the spring onions and lime juice while serving and serve hot!
Enjoy!!! We appreciate your likes, comments and suggestions.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I haven't tried this before, but now I think I should try it once...

item.title: Lemon Chiffon Cake
item.dc:creator: foodstruk
item.content:encoded:
I really wanted make this for a long time and finally the day arrived. I referred to couple of blogs to make this however I had m Ingredients:
  • Cake flour - 3/4 cup (Take one level cup of all-purpose flour, remove two tablespoons, and then add two tablespoons of corn starch back in.)
  • Baking soda - 1/4 teaspoon
  • Salt - 1/4 teaspoon
  • Sugar (Granulated) - 3/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon
  • Large eggs, separated - 3
  • Vegetable oil - 1/4 cup
  • Freshly squeezed lemon juice - 1 tablespoon
  • Grated lemon zest, (about 4 lemons) - 2 tablespoons
  • Pure vanilla extract - 1/2 teaspoon
  • Cream of tartar - 1/4 teaspoon
  • Confectioners' sugar, for dusting
In a bowl, sift together flour, baking soda, salt, and 3/4 cup granulated sugar; set aside. In a large bowl, whisk together egg yolks, vegetable oil, 1/3 cup water, lemon juice, lemon zest and vanilla. Add reserved dry ingredients, and beat until smooth. Take another bowl, beat egg whites on medium speed until foamy using an electric beater.  Add cream of tartar; beat on high speed until soft peaks form, about 1 minute. Now gradually add remaining tablespoon of granulated sugar; beat on high speed until stiff peaks form, about 2 minutes. Gradually fold egg-white mixture into the batter; start by folding in 1/3, then fold in the remaining 2/3. Pour batter into pan. Using an offset spatula, smooth the top. Heat oven to 325 degrees and have ready an ungreased 7-inch tube pan Bake until a toothpick (or a cake tester) inserted in the middle of the cake comes out clean and the cake is golden, about 45 to 50 minutes. Remove cake from oven; let it cool for 2 hours. Run a table knife all the way down between cake and pan; invert the pan, and remove cake by tapping it on the bottom. Dust cake with confectioners' sugar before serving.

item.title: Chargha
item.dc:creator: foodstruk
item.content:encoded:
Charga is a whole chicken marinated (overnight) with spices and hung curd, steamed and deep fried. It is popular in few parts of Asia, originated from Lahore, Pakistan. It is really very quick and easy to make and tastes heavenly. It is great option for small get-together.

Ingredients:

  • Whole chicken - 3 Lbs or 1.5 kg (With slits all over)
  • Hung Curd - 1/2 cup
  • Fresh Lime Juice - 1/4 cup
  • Red chili powder - 1 1/2 tablespoon
  • Salt - Adequate
  • Garlic Ginger Paste - 1 tablespoon
  • Chat Masala - 2 teaspoon
  • Garam Masala - 1 tablespoon
  • Oil - Adequate for deep frying
  • Egg - 1 Large
  • Colors - Red, Yellow a pinch each (optional); Here I used red chili, turmeric.

Process:

  • In a bowl crack the egg; add salt, red chili powder, hung curd, ginger garlic paste, chat masala (1 teaspoon) and garam masala. Mix all gently to make a paste.
  • Apply the mixture on the chicken and make sure it gets applied in the slits too. Tie the legs crossed with a thread as shown in the image to retain its shape and look. Also it gets easier to handle when tied.

  • Marinate this for at least 3 to 4 hours. For best results marinate it overnight.
  • Then steam the chicken in any steamer for 20 minutes make sure it’s not over cooked. (I used my Idli cooker have rice cooker steamer which was small for it.)
[caption id="attachment_600" align="alignnone" width="300"] Before Steaming[/caption] [caption id="attachment_601" align="alignnone" width="300"] After Steaming[/caption]
  • Take oil in a pan and deep fry the chicken until it turns golden brown.
  • Now Chargha is ready. Now sprinkle the chat masala and serve it with lemon and onion and mint chutney.

Enjoy!!! We appreciate your likes, comments and suggestions.

item.title: How to make Khoa (Mawa/Khoya) at home
item.dc:creator: foodstruk
item.content:encoded:
I had lot of milk left so thought of making Mawa out of it and planned to use it in different sweets. Making mawa at home is a long process so I generally prefer to do it while cooking other stuff like either Lunch or Dinner as it roughly takes 2 hours overall. I know we generally tend to buy this in the market, but homemade is so much better. Ingredients:
  • Milk - 2 litres
Procedure:
  • Pour the milk into a nonstick pan and bring to boil on a medium flame.
  • Now reduce the flame to low and let it simmer. Keep stirring at regular intervals.
  • Milk froths many times while simmering so keep stirring the milk.
  • After continuous simmering, Malai / Milk-solids appear on the top and the sides of the pan. So scrape these milk solids.
  • After 1 to 1.5 hours the milk gets reduced considerably and gets thickened.
  • Keep continuously stirring for few more minutes until it solidifies and you observe that there are no bubbles in the reduced milk and you get this texture as shown in the picture.
  • Now turn the stove off and move this to an air tight container after cooling it down you can refrigerate. This stays good at least for 3 to 4 days.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: […] lot of Indian sweets are made using Khoya / Khoa / Mawa. Khoya can be made at home… It’s easy to make, but time consuming process. It is easily available in the market. I […]

item.title: Anjeer Mawa Barfi
item.dc:creator: foodstruk
item.content:encoded:
A lot of Indian sweets are made using Khoya / Khoa / Mawa. Khoya can be made at home... It's easy to make, but time consuming process. It is easily available in the market. I had lot of milk at home and made Khoa out of it. So I was looking at different Barfi options I found TarlaDalal's Anjeer Barfi was the best and I tweaked it a little and came up with Anjeer Mawa Barfi.

Ingredients:

  • Dried figs / Anjeer - Chopped 3/4 cup
  • Mawa / Khoya / Khoa - 1 Cup Crumbled
  • Elaichi / Cardamom Powder - 1/2 teaspoon
  • Chopped nuts - 1/4 cup (Almonds, Pistachios, and Cashews)
  • Water - 1/2 cup
  • Sugar - 2 tablespoon
  • Ghee - 2 tablespoon

Method:

  • In a nonstick pan, on medium heat mix the sugar, dried figs and water and cook for 3-4 minutes or till the water evaporates.
  • Now add the ghee, cardamom powder and Mawa. Mix well and keep stirring continuously. Let it cook together for about 2 minutes.
  • Add the nuts, mix well and cook for another minute. Turn off the gas
  • Now grease a plate or anything flat with ghee. Transfer the mixture on it and flatten it out evenly using a spoon or spatula.
  • Garnish with the remaining nuts if you wish. Keep it aside for 2-3 hours at room temperature.
  • Cut in desired shapes and sizes
  • Serve or store it in an air tight container in the fridge.

Enjoy!!! We appreciate your likes, comments and suggestions.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: pl send us your contact detail

item.title: Coconut Mawa Barfi
item.dc:creator: foodstruk
item.content:encoded:
After Anjeer Mawa Barfi, I had some more Mawa left, so tried Coconut Mawa Barfi and it turned out to be pretty amazing and tasty. So thought of adding it too to my blogs list.

Ingredients:
  • Desiccated Coconut - 1/2 Cup
  • Mawa / Khoya / Khoa - 1 Cup Crumbled
  • Elaichi / Cardamom Powder - 1/2 teaspoon
  • Chopped nuts - 1/4 cup (Almonds, Pistachios, and Cashews)
  • Milk - 1/4 Cup
  • Sugar - 2 tablespoon
  • Ghee - 1 tablespoon
Method:
  • In a nonstick pan, add Ghee, desiccated coconut and fry until it turns light brown on a low heat.
  • Add milk and then add Mawa to it, and keep stirring continuously. Let it cook together for about 1 minute until it gets dry.
  • Add cardamom powder, half of chopped nuts, mix well and cook for another minute. Turn off the gas.
  • Now grease a plate or anything flat with ghee. Transfer the mixture on it and flatten it out evenly using a spoon or spatula.
  • Garnish with the remaining nuts if you wish. Keep it aside for 2-3 hours at room temperature.
  • Cut in desired shapes and sizes
  • Serve or store it in an air tight container in the fridge.
Enjoy!!! We appreciate your likes, comments and suggestions.
